thread.title: The Best VPN Services for 2017

author: Cale Hunt
title: The Best VPN Services for 2017
text:
What are the best Virtual Private Networks (VPNs)?
Updated March 28, 2017: We overhauled this list to give you a better selection of the best VPNs available right now.
A VPN can be described as an encrypted tunnel that shuttles your internet activity between your PC or phone and a host server. While the internet is a public space, a VPN works by extending an invisibility cloak across the user's activity and allows people to send and receive data in a mostly-anonymous manner. In the simplest terms, a VPN makes it hard for someone to track your activity.
There are many different reasons people would want to use a VPN. In some countries, VPNs become a journalist's main tool to get around government censorship and geo-blocks.
It's true, there are plenty of free VPN services out there, but none that you can truly trust. You need a service that has fast speeds even when streaming video, and you want a service that doesn't keep logs of its users' activities. To help you decide which VPN is best, here are some great options that are available now.
